snippet: The median household’s income last year was $56,500, a significant increase from the previous year, the Census Bureau said....
abstract: The Upshot; Census Bureau reports sharp economic gains in 2015, with median household incomes rising 5.2 percent from previous year to $56,500 while poverty fell; also reports increase in health care coverage, with only 9.1 percent of people uninsured; while poverty and income remain problematic, numbers represent significant emergence from effects of recession; data contradicts campaign trail claims made by Donald Trump.

byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti contributed from Clive, Iowa

lead_paragraph: The median household’s income last year was $56,500, a significant increase from the previous year, the Census Bureau said.

headline.main: U.S. Household Income Grew 5.2 Percent in 2015, Breaking Pattern of Stagnation
headline.print_headline: Incomes in U.S. Are Up Sharply; Poor Gain Most

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
